intro: Athrixia rosmarinifolia, commonly known as the rosemary bush or rosmarinifolia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a low-growing, perennial shrub native to southern Africa. The plant features aromatic, needle-like leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its small, white flowers appear in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Athrixia rosmarinifolia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
